name: Andaz Liverpool Street

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and service
reviews.text: My wife and myself stayed 3 nights at the Andaz Liverpool. The hotel staff were friendly and always ready to help out, hotel facilities, room great decor and well maintained, 5 stars. Would recommend staying in this hotel for a lovely relaxing time, very central location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheers
reviews.title: Luxurious, welcoming stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rudy
reviews.title: Fancy-shmancy hotel in a nice section of London.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend last September. Check in was swift and efficient, room was upgraded which was a nice touch. Very spacious, a rarity in London for that price. Great location, easy access to Hoxton, Shoreditch, Columbia Road and central London. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I normally stay in the Mayfair section of London (at the Hilton Hyde Park), but they were fully booked, so we tried the Andaz Liverpool Street hotel. Glad we did. It was something fun and different, though I'm not sure if I'd return (as it didn't include breakfast in the room rate, which is something I prefer).
reviews.title: Great stay in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay here and found the staff without exception went out of their way to help with anything you requested.While situated in the Financial District this hotel is still an easy Tube or bus ride to most places in the city. It is also round the corner from Petticoat Lane and its market which was very interesting on Sunday morning.
reviews.title: Lovely Staff

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel about four times over the last few years. Originally it was the Great Eastern hotel and at that time it was a very contempory change to the normal London hotel. Since it's been taken over by Hyatt and renamed to the Andaz they've made a number of changes:
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel, but quirky service

reviews.text: - check-in is performed by a bunch of people wandering about with laptops in the lobby. There is no reception desk and therefore nowhere to line up to checkin. This is somewhat frustrating when you're a Hyatt member that's entitled to priority checkin etc.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: - room servuce is very very slow.
reviews.title: Really nice property, good location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the minibar is included, but filled with unusual fruity drinks. Gone are the days of having a quiet English shot before nodding off!
reviews.title: very impressed

reviews.text: Alluring 'avant garde' Andaz
reviews.title: Alluring 'avant garde' Andaz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: MANY people complain that London's hotels are not very good, and I well remember the awful experience I had when I stayed in the Charles Dickens Hotel years ago. I was kept awake by the rattling of the water pipes all night long in the Charles Dickens! The Andaz is another story. It is a good hotel.
reviews.title: Andaz Excellent Again

reviews.text: One of the Hyatt's new brands. Andaz means 'personal style' or ‘please’ in the Urdu language, and it is one of the most avant garde hotels I have stayed in. As The Travelling Gourmet, renowned Travel, Food & Wine Writer, I have stayed in all manner of accommodation from remote jungle villas in Thailand to famed Agriturismos in Italy, but this hotel really does have its own seductive eclectic style.
reviews.title: Exceptionally impressive

reviews.text: Right next to Liverpool Street Train Station and the ‘tube’, you can get from here to anywhere in London in minutes.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.text: Check in is unique and is barrier free as the pretty ladies, who are also Concierges do everything for you on their lap top computers.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: This hotel was brilliant. My partner and I stayed here for two nights and were really impressed. The service was impeccable with staff bending over backwards to ensure we had everything we needed for a great stay. The breakfast was delicious with a wide selection although it was a large buffet for all rather than an a la carte menu or continental buffet that we thought we had to choose from.
reviews.title: Best hotel i have stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was gorgeous and the free mini bar (excluding the alcohol) was filled daily with a good selection of snacks and drinks. The bath and shower were great and little extras like the ipod dock was fab. But by far the best thing about this hotel was the BED! Most comfortable bed in the world and we even checked the make of the duvet and pillows - I must have one! Well done andaz.
reviews.title: Beaut hotel in central London location

reviews.text: This beautiful hotel is very close to Liverpool Street Station, shops and restaurants. The bedroom was a good size for a London hotel and very smartly furnished. We were impressed by free soft drinks and snacks from the mini-bar and the quality of sheets, towels and bathroom amenities. Only criticism is that the over-the-bath shower was a big step from bath to floor which was a little tricky to negotiate. On the plus side, however, breakfast was really delicious with great variety to choose from.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Loved my stay at Andaz Liverpool Street - definitely my hotel of choice for business or leisure travel in London. Large, modern rooms with complimentary wi-fi and mini-bar. Well equipped 24-hour gym and one of the best hotel breakfasts in London. Can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Cool hotel in a cool location

reviews.text: Great location next to Liverpool Street Station, on the eastern edge of the central City and bordering the fun, hip Spitalfields and other East End areas, near Brick Lane, and a short walk from the Tower of London. The hotel was formerly the Great Eastern, which Hyatt renovated for its Andaz brand. Everything is sleek and well designed, kind of boutique-y but not annoyingly so. I was there on a business trip and had a single room, which was plenty big enough to feel comfortable working in. I really appreciate that the wireless internet, use of printers in the business center, and non-alcoholic beverages and snacks in the mini-bar are all free - I hate being nickel-and-dimed by expensive hotels. That said, the room rates are maybe near the high end of the range for comparable hotels in London, but not out of line for London. Some glitches in service, but the staff listens and is professional and eager to please.
reviews.title: one night disappointed

description: Uncover the first of Hyatt's Andaz brand, and redefine your personal style at Andaz Liverpool Street. Located in the heart of the city, this London 5-star luxury hotel provides the perfect location for both business and leisure. One of the original London railway hotels, formerly opened as the Great Eastern, the Andaz is housed in a beautiful redbrick Victorian building dating back to 1884. Once inside, it transforms into a 21st century masterpiece, with 267 beautifully appointed modern guest rooms. Walking through the doors of the only Liverpool Street hotel, you are immediately greeted by an Andaz Host and invited to relax in the Andaz Lounge. Sip a complimentary beverage while the check-in comes to you via handheld PC. Internet access, local landline phone calls and non-alcoholic mini-bar are provided complimentary for all our guests throughout their stay.Andaz Liverpool Street is included in 2013's Conde Nast Traveller Gold List.
